gui

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Window
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Main window of the application.
    Author:
    Dániel Gál
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window()
        Class constructor

        Creates a menu on the top of the window and a DrawingBoard in the center.

    • Method Detail

      • initPanels

        private void initPanels()
        Initialize JPanels

        Creates basic empty panels with layouts and adds them to the menu.

      • initButtons

        private void initButtons()
        Initialize buttons

        Creates all the buttons, places them on the panels and adds ActionListeners to all of them.

      • initColor

        private void initColor()
        Inizialize color selection data structure

        Creates a HashMap with the color JToggleButtons as the keys and the Colors as the values. Adds ActionListeners to the buttons.

      • initToolOptions

        private void initToolOptions()
        Initialize tool selection and tool options

        Creates a JComboBox with the tools, a JSlider and a JTextField for changing the tool size.

      • initMenu

        private void initMenu()
        Calls all the initXxx() functions.

      • windowResizeFix

        private void windowResizeFix()
        This method is making sure that the minimum window size constraint is working on all platforms. (It was not working on Ubuntu with i3 window manager)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Override of the KeyListener interface's keyPressed method. Not used but has to be implemented
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • sizeSliderChanged

        private void sizeSliderChanged()
        The method that gets called when the JSlider changes.

        Sets the size of the currently selected tool as well as the value in the JTextField.

      • sizeTextChanged

        private void sizeTextChanged()
        The method that gets called when the JTextField changes.

        Sets the size of the currently selected tool as well as the value in the JSlider.

      • toolComboBoxChanged

        private void toolComboBoxChanged()
        The method that gets called when the JComboBox changes.

        Selects the tool currently displayed in the JComboBox. Calls colorSelection() so that the selected tool has the currently selected color and sets the size to the current size values in the JTextField and the JSlider.

      • saveButtonPressed

        private void saveButtonPressed()
        The method that gets called when the Save button is pressed.

        Opens a dialog window where the user can type in a path where they want their image saved. The BufferedImage gets written to a .PNG file.

      • openButtonPressed

        private void openButtonPressed()
        The method that gets called when the Open button is pressed.

        Opens a dialog window where the user can type in a path of the image they want to open. The .PNG image gets read into a BufferedImage object and it is set as the DrawingBoard's BufferedImages component.

      • colorSelection

        public void colorSelection()
        Color selection method

        Detects which JToggleButton is currently selected and sets the color of the currently selected tool to that color.
